SVGTextContentElementGetCharNumAtPositio.summary: The getCharNumAtPosition() method of the interface represents the character which caused a text glyph to be rendered at a given position in the coordinate system. Because the relationship between characters and glyphs is not one-to-one, only the first character of the relevant typographic character is returned.

remarks.para: If no character is found at the specified position, -1 is returned.

SVGTextContentElementGetCharNumAtPositio.returns: A long; the index of the character that corresponds to the position.
